agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Transportation TIME & DATE: 2:00 PM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, May 1, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. Terry Canales *Public testimony may be limited to two (2) minutes.* If submitting written documentation, please provide 15 copies (with your name on each) to the committee clerk before or during the hearing. If you intend to testify, please register using the electronic witness affirmation form, which will be available at any registration kiosk located throughout the Capitol Extension. Witness registration will open approximately two (2) hours prior to the start of the hearing and must be completed prior to testifying. HB 3949 Perez Relating to the administration of navigation districts. SB 228 Hinojosa Relating to the designation of a portion of U.S. Highway 281 as the Corporal Roel Garcia Memorial Highway. SB 688 Perry Relating to height limitations for certain vehicles transporting seed cotton or cotton. SB 1219 Alvarado Relating to human trafficking signs at certain transportation hubs. SB 1221 Campbell | et al. Relating to the designation of a portion of Ranch-to-Market Road 150 in Hays County as the William B. Travis Heritage Trail. SB 1271 Watson Relating to the issuance of Keep Austin Weird specialty license plates. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
